p: Some previous studies have focused on the theory of the interactions between different viruses [ 13, 14]. Due to data limitations, we could not infer how the circulation of COVID-19 influenced influenza transmission in detail. Still, it is worth studying since they might co-circulate in the coming seasons. For influenza, once a lineage/subtype reaches the peak and then declines, the other lineage/subtype might soon arise. Whether there will be a similar phenomenon for the co-circulation of influenza and COVID-19 remains unknown.
